casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Edgar Nelson PITTS, Defendant-Appellant. No. 01-7275. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted Nov. 29, 2001. Decided Dec. 10, 2001. Edgar Nelson Pitts, pro se. Thomas Jack Bondurant, Jr., Assistant United *253States Attorney, Roanoke, VA, for appel-lee.

Before WIDENER, NIEMEYER, and WILLIAMS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Edgar Nelson Pitts seeks to appeal the district court’s order denying his motion filed under 28 U.S.C.A. § 2255 (West Supp. 2001). We have reviewed the record and the district court’s opinion and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we deny a certificate of appealability and dismiss the appeal on the reasoning of the district court. See United States v. Pitts, Nos. CR-94-68; CA-00-848-7 (W.D.Va. Apr. 30, 2001). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

DISMISSED.
